name: Traders Hotel, Hong Kong

reviews.text: I just returned from a solid stay at the NCHV. Checked in on Sunday morning and room was made available within an hour. Even received an upgrade to a Harbourview room on the 26th floor, which is one of their "BIZ" floors. Room was rather small, but it did not cause a problem, as I was travelling on my own. The location of the hotel is ok, although not exceptional, as you have to take a taxi, which I did a couple of times, to get to the Star Ferry & Central. These are very cheap and set you back two pounds each way, which equals HKD 30. I would not recommend breakfast, as it is not value for money at all. Rather have a little business breakfast in their business centre, which is located on 1st floor, which is charged at HKD 28 rather than the 128 they charge you in the restaurant. Another recommendation for improvement would be the servicing of the room, which never happened before late afternoon. All in all a good experience especially when considering the small amount of HKD 460/night paid (booked via their website). If you do not mind taking a 5 minute taxi ride to Central, this is certainly an acceptable place to stay.
reviews.title: Value for money

likes.disliked: — The late servicing of the room and the poor breakfast in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is reasonably well-appointed. Staff were helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid ~ $900 HK per night all told, which was fairly cheap. Fairly close to Sheung Wan MTR (less than $20 HK for a taxi). Sheung Wan is a "chinese" part of HK yet accessible to tourists, thus interesting. Airport is quickly reached by taxi through Western Tunnel, as is Kowloon.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly, Modern Hotel

reviews.text: Main cons:
reviews.title: Perfect for a city break

likes.liked: — The hotel was clean, friendly and away from the busy town
likes.disliked: — Very high building with approx 30 floors

reviews.text: * immediate surroundings run-down (but feels safe). Rooms at back (south side) look over dilapidated apartment blocks which may be just 10m away (you get a glimpse of Victoria Peak as well ;-))
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Jen in Hong Kong for 4 nights in June 2010 and absolutley fell in love with Hong Kong! We never usually re-visit places but if we did re-visit Hong Kong would definatley stay at Hotel Jen again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Clean & Staff helpful, great base to see Hong Kong!

reviews.text: The Hotel is loated on Hong Kong and although not directly connected to the MTR (underground) it is really easy to get the tram from just down the road to Cental (where you can get on the ferries to Kowloon and other outlying islands). The trams also go further a field and cost just 2HGD to use per time, equallying pennies! We loved that we had to use the tram as it made us experience Hong Kong like the locals do!
reviews.title: Jen is good value, clean, and comfortable

reviews.text: The people on reception at the hotel were really helpful, we had a problem through out travel agent "Gold Medal" who had sold us the hotel advising we would receive breakfast but hadn't passed this message on to Hotel Jen. The hotel continuously emailed our travel agent to try to resolve the problem, although they wouldn't ring the UK they really did try their best to help us!
reviews.title: Great Location with Reasonable price for Hong Kong Island

reviews.text: Our room was cleaned daily and the hotel is very modern and although we didn't use the pool we went and had a look and the pool area was very clean and inviting.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, clean and great value

reviews.text: The only strange thing about the hotel is the breasfast set up at The Jen Cafe. They advertise that breakfast is seved until 10am however if you arrive any time after 9.30a.m you are greeted by a very rude man who shouts at you "breakfast is only till 10", then at like 5 to 10 they start clearing the hot food away! Quite strange as usually at other hotels as long as you are there before ten they would continue to be polite and seat you at a table.
reviews.title: great Hotel for little money

reviews.text: The taxi driver laughed when we said Novotel Century Harbourview his reaction was "harbourview" and then he laughed. You get a glimpse of water between the buildings in front. We arrived to find the pool was being renovated and being in this part of town there is not much else to do so it was a taxi or shuttle bus to go anywhere of interest or for good shopping. Beds were also very hard. Would find somewhere else to stay.
reviews.title: Find somewhere else to stay

reviews.text: We are a family of 4 from New Zealand (kids 11 and 9 and Go the All Blacks) and stayed at the Harbourview for 5 nights in July 2007 where we had two adjoining rooms. We thought the hotel was very good and would recommend it.
reviews.title: We liked the Harbourview

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and of good size with air conditioning/hot water etc working very well. Hotel staff were very good - reception were always friendly and offered good advice on good restaurants etc. and check in/check out etc was a breeze. Bell boys and other staff were always friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — Location not much around to do

reviews.text: Other reviews have mentioned the location and it is correct that it is a distance from Central (about 4 ks or 2.5 miles for Red Sox or Cub supporters) but the hotel has a very reliable shuttle bus service that runs every hour into town (except Sunday). Also taxis are cheap and the tram about 100 metres away takes you downtown so location is not a problem. Moreover, the hotel is located in an historic part of HK which is very Chinese which we thought was a real bonus of the location.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

likes.disliked: — The distance from the MTR station

reviews.text: Taxi from airport was about $380HK and about 25 minutes.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: My wife, two-year-old-daughter and I stayed at Traders (formerly Hotel Jen) while my wife was in Hong Kong for a few days on business. We cannot rate them highly enough.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff. Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived the staff were there to help. We stayed on the Traders Club Lounge Floor with a harbour view room and it was a lovely bit of luxury to return to each evening. Massive bed with all the trimmings you'd expect from a hotel like this including free wifi.
reviews.title: If you want to feel you are in midst of Hong Kong, this is the place you should stay in

reviews.text: The thing that put this hotel right up there with the best we've ever stayed at was the Traders Club Lounge on the 28th Floor. If you stay on the 18th floor or above you'll get access to the Lounge where breakfast is served. You can go there anytime during the day and get free snacks and soft drinks. There's also cocktails and canapes (including lovely won tons) for free between 5:30 and 7:30pm. We met up here with my wife's work colleagues each evening and it was a great start to the night. The staff there made us feel right at home and really took a shine to our two-year-old as well. In some places you can be made to feel like a burden when you're travelling with a child - but not here.
reviews.title: The real Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool on the 29th Floor is also lovely - it's out in the open so not great when it rains but it's well maintained and there are two staff there to look after you if need be.
reviews.title: Comfortable and functional

reviews.text: The other great thing about Traders is the free shuttle bus that runs from early morning through to about 7pm at night. As the hotel is in Kennedy Town and a decent walk from the nearest MTR (they are building one very near to the hotel at the moment) the shuttle bus is a god send. It operates to the major drop off points in Hong Kong (Macau Ferry Terminal, Star Ferry Terminal and Hong Kong and Central MTR stations). Alternatively, you can walk one street parallel to the hotel towards the harbour and get on a tram.
reviews.title: Wonderful rest !

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night on business. I picked the hotel on account of the Novotel branding (which translates to me as meaning 3.5 - 4 star hotel/room/location/service) and the price. True to the meaning, the hotel was good value - no fuss and efficient.
reviews.title: Nice Property
Enjoyed our stay.
reviews.text: It was close enough to the centre to do business. Taxis were easy to get and commuting to the centre and or the nearest Metro station was relatively inexpensive.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel buttttttt
reviews.text: Everything about the Hotel from check-in/out to the room to the service was pleasant and efficient. I was upgraded to a Deluxe Room with a view of the hillside. The room was reasonable.
The drawbacks:
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel, location not great though

reviews.text: We were given Room 1511 located at the corner. Room was small and we can hear ppl using the tap or toilet from other rooms. Carpet and blanket looked dirty. Shower was disappointing. The water pressure was low, water flow was inconsistent.
reviews.title: Dislike this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is okay. There is a free shuttle bus to bring you around within central, wanchai area. Location wise, not near to main acitivities area but it is not deserted at all.
reviews.title: Did not really like this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, we dont like this hotel and we were thankful that we were there for 2 nights only due to stop-over.
reviews.title: off the beaten track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older hotel in the heart of Hong Kong island. It is not close to the Mass Transport System although the hotel does have a shuttle during the day.
reviews.title: Good deal

reviews.text: really nice hotel for an acceptable price. wonderful view on the harbor.
reviews.title: will book this hotel again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very clean, all interior seems brand new.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but scaffolding spoils view in 2010

reviews.text: If you pay a little extra for the executive rooms, you can have a harbor view, executive lounge and breakfast on the 28th floor.
reviews.title: Hongkong Jenn short review

reviews.text: Evening buffet is crowded, but the choice is enormous
reviews.title: Modern and pleasant

reviews.text: Fitness room is small but the rooftop pool is lovely.
reviews.title: Good location and view. We upgraded rooms...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Jen is a stylish and chic hotel - it's reasonably priced too! I loved the gorgeous white interior of the lobby - it's grand and fashionable but welcoming too. There's nothing old or outdated about the Jen.
reviews.title: Chic, stylish and pretty central

reviews.text: The rooms are adequet size for a couple and are kept spotlessly clean. The real draw is the roof top pool. The views out across the city and the harbour are wonderful and even if you're only there for a few days it's worth it.
reviews.title: Modern, clean and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff are warm and friendly and the place is easy to get to on the bus from Hong Kong's airport. Navigating from the hotel around the city is also very easy.
reviews.title: Styish and good value hotel on the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great find. I paid around $70/night for a good sized rooms (two single beds), with Harbor views. The hotel itself is clean and modern, with a fitness center and a rooftop pool, that was completely empty when I was there! It was perfect for a single traveler. Some people say it's out of the way, I actually thought it was fairly convenient from the airport (the A10 bus stops right outside the hotel), and to the tram. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus service to the Star Ferry terminal/Central (and other stops), which I took advantage of. It was also a $4 cab ride to Airport Express. For the money, I thought this was a very good hotel.
reviews.title: I got a standard room - reposted

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and had a room on the executive floor. We were impressed by the modern fittings and the style of the hotel and the rooms were a reasonable size for a hotel in HKG. While the hotel had good views across the harbour and was on the island so near a lot of the sights, it was a little way beyond the end of the MTR which meant a bit of extra travelling time. The bed was the most comfy we slept in on our trip and the rooftop swimming pool was rather cool! The breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Loved our room .

description: Traders Hotel, Hong Kong, offers 283 elegant rooms and suites. From the economical to opulent, each room is characterised by clean lines and functional creativity. These accommodations are enhanced by wireless Internet connections, LCD televisions and sweeping views of Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong city and distant mountains. 3 rooms caters to disabled guests, and 84 rooms have connecting doors.
